pageContext.claim: “We lost thousands of factories and millions of jobs because of NAFTA -- thousands. Think of it: Thousands of factories, millions of jobs.”
pageContext.analysis: Under NAFTA, the supply chain of the auto industry became integrated between the United States and its immediate neighbors. Auto parts and vehicles produced in each country freely flow over the borders, without tariffs or other restrictions, as thousands of part suppliers serve the automakers that build the vehicles. An estimated 40 percent of goods sent to the United States by Mexico incorporate U.S. content, according to the International Trade Administration.
